intro: Centropogon latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and thrives in partial to full sun. Its flowers are often brightly colored, ranging from red to orange, attracting various pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Centropogon latifolius is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and landscapes.
